input_text.Prompt:
Conversation:
Jennifer: What's wrong with you? Why are you scratching so much?
Deenah: I feel itchy! I can't stand it anymore! I think I may be coming down with something. I feel lightheaded and weak.
Jennifer: Let me have a look. Whoa! Get away from me!
Deenah: What's wrong?
Jennifer: I think you have chicken pox! You are contagious! Get away! Don't breathe on me!
Deenah: Maybe it's just a rash or an allergy! We can't be sure until I see a doctor.
Jennifer: Well in the meantime you are a biohazard! I didn't get it when I was a kid and I've heard that you can even die if you get it as an adult!
Deenah: Are you serious? You always blow things out of proportion. In any case, I think I'll go take an oatmeal bath.

Now write a summary of the conversation:
input_text.Response A: Jennifer is concerned about Deenah's itchy skin and lightheadedness, suspecting chicken pox. She tells Deenah to stay away and not breathe on her as chicken pox is contagious. Deenah insists that she needs to see a doctor first to be sure of the diagnosis. Jennifer is alarmed and tells Deenah that chicken pox can be dangerous if contracted as an adult. Deenah decides to take an oatmeal bath and leaves the conversation.
input_text.Response B: Deenah has chicken pox. Jennifer doesn't want to be near her because she's contagious. Jennifer believes she could die if she gets it.

label_annotations.factors_a: A is a better more comprehensive summary
label_annotations.factors_b: B is more to the point, summary
